text: the truth is that our society is
populated by an unknown number of
genuine monsters the NRA's wayne
lapierre presents a conundrum his
polarizing rhetoric since the Newtown
elementary school shooting has gotten
him some terrible reviews not just on
the left but a few on the right
legislatively however mr. Lapierre has
been pretty successful the only thing
that stops a bad guy with a gun is a
good guy with a gun I'm Jodie canter of
the New York Times the Senate is about
to consider background checks
however stricter measures like bans on
high-capacity magazines or assault
weapons are not expected to get through
Congress that is largely the work of
Wayne LaPierre and the organization he
helped build gun control advocates call
him a performer paid to scare people
into thinking they need to arm
themselves you know Wayne reminds me of
the clowns at the circus they get the
most attention and that's what he's paid
to do but mr. Lapierre uses the
criticism directed at him to his
advantage to introduce him at a
conservative political conference
earlier this year the NRA produced this
video the message no matter what critics
say about him Wayne LaPierre will
represent the interests of gun owners in
their distorted view of the world
they're smarter than we are
they're special they're more worthy than
we are the thing to remember about mr.
Lapierre which you can't see on TV is
the close and trusting relationship he
has with the NRA membership which he's
personally built to over the years he
spends almost every weekend traveling
around the country talking to members
and for our Second Amendment freedom mr.
president we will stand and fight
throughout this country as Americans for
our freedom the question is whether this
approach still works at a time when gun
control advocates are
arguing that mr. Lapierre is out of
touch even with his own membership
incoming days on Capitol Hill we may get
our first glimpse of the answer
